page.title: 11Life of Illston Farmer -cont
page.content: indoors and deals with any business i.e. post, telephone calls, etc. while having a cup of coffee. His next task will depend on the time of year. He could be ploughing, cultivating, seeding, harvesting. He always finds time to check his sheep. He has 100 ewes and 5 rams. Lunch is a cooked meal at around 1 o'clock. Liz is in every sense a traditional farmer's wife. They eat simple, nourishing food and avoid convenience foods. They own a freezer and enjoy home produced meat and poulltry. Liz also grows vegetables in her garden and fruits. She makes a variety of jams each year. She deals with the farm office work, still finding time to tackle dressmaking and floral arrangements in the church. Life on the farm changes with the seasons. Ian does most of his own
